Author: Goladus
Content: Good advice, although try to be tasteful repeating the name in conversation.  It can get irritating when somebody keeps repeating my name over and over again to my face.

Author: nostrademons
Content: The hosting site is just an intermediary.  The link is to a presentation by the chief architect of Plaxo (15M users says he probably knows what he's talking about), and it's just hosted on SlideShare.

Content:

Which leads me to my main question: How much does compeition motivate you?

Content: I am reminded of the quote (variously attributed), "Ideas are like assholes. Everybody's got one; no one wants to see YOURS..."

Author: mynameishere
Content: By the way, everyone, I'm quite aware of how inflation works. The point is: The C64 was roughly as good as any home computer of the day. The OLPC is bottom of the heap, and I can pick up a used computer for 20 dollars that would shred it.

Author: robmnl
Title: ONE preview launch
Content:
Hello everyone,

I'm excited to be launching a preview for the ONE application platform today.

ONE is a web platform for productivity applications like calendars, task management, project management, invoicing, ...

It's an open platform so everybody will be able to develop on it (apps are written in HTML/JS).

Please let me know your thoughts.

Here's the initial post: http://onejournal.wordpress.com

The homepage: http://unobeta.com

The developers corner, this might be interesting for you hackers: http://unobeta.com/developers

Brave souls can try the first application written on ONE, a basic calendar: http://unobeta.com/apps/calendar.html

\nEnjoy

Author: icky
Content:
Maybe a better approach would be to silently gather statistics and find out the degree of correlation between any given user's "inappropriate" rating and the actual (as determined by you) inappropriateness of any given item.

Then, if someone has, say, a NEGATIVE correlation between their inappropriateness rating and the actual inappropriateness of said item, you can still use that person's ratings as a useful source of information... just not the way they intended ;-)

Author: angryprofessor
Content:
You might try looking for controversy. I've thought about this more for reddit/slashdot comments than for polls, but here are my ideas:

For comments on a point based site (such as reddit, this site if it gets popular), there are signs that a post is being downmodded by people who disagree. For instance, -10 points, 10 replies. Or 10 upmods, 12 downmods.

In your case, this would probably be 10 "innappropriates", and another 20-30 people actually using the poll. You might also look for people clicking "innappropriate" and then voting in the poll.

Author: mechanical_fish
Content:
In case you're curious, the Inflation Calculator [1] reports that $135 in 1982 dollars is $289 in 2006 dollars.

That's the C64 production cost, not a retail price. The MSRP of the Commodore 64 was $595 in 1982 ($1272.61 in 2006 dollars).

[1] http://www.westegg.com/inflation/
